__TOC__


Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged.  

You might find it more convenient to edit the wiki page using <code>editmoin</code> a command line utility for editing moinmoin wiki pages.  It is available as a package in Gutsy and Hardy.  More information including an easier way to do this was <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-bugsquad/2007-November/000666.html|mailed]]</nowiki> to the Bug Squad. 

=== 5-a-day-ing ===

During hug days you can also do <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day|5-A-Day]]</nowiki> for this one you can do the following in order to tag your work on the hug day:
 
* 5-a-day --add-tag hugday-20080610
* Add bugs to 5-a-day as usual 
* And when done with hug day run: 5-a-day --remove-tag hugday-20080610

More information about <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day#Tag|tags here]]</nowiki>.

=== All Bugs ===
If they deal with a distribution upgrade should be tagged so they indicate what they were trying to upgrade from and to e.g. '''feisty2gutsy''', '''gutsy2hardy''' or '''dapper2hardy'''.

If they deal with an upgrade using media (CD-ROM or DVD) they should be tagged as '''cdrom-upgrade'''.

Information regarding how to debug update-manager can be found in the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingUpdateManager|wiki]]</nowiki>.

=== 100 bugs New bugs about update-manager ===
These bug reports have been reported about update-manager and are still in a New status.  You can find other new update manager bugs in <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/update-manager/+bugs?field.searchtext=&orderby=-importance&search=Search&field.status%3Alist=NEW&assignee_option=any&field.assignee=&field.bug_reporter=&field.bug_contact=&field.bug_commenter=&field.subscriber=&field.status_upstream-empty-marker=1&field.omit_dupes.used=&field.omit_dupes=on&field.has_patch.used=&field.has_cve.used=&field.tag=&field.tags_combinator=ANY|Launchpad]]</nowiki>.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Ask the reporter for the log files in '/var/log/dist-upgrade/' and set the bug to "Incomplete"  '''or'''
* If all log files are present change the status to "Confirmed" and set an importance (if you are not a QA member ask someone for help) '''or'''
* Search for duplicates (and mark if found)

=== 50 Confirmed bugs about update-manager ===
These bug reports have been reported about update-manager and are in the Confirmed state.  The list contains the 25 newest Confirmed bug reports and the 25 oldest.  The bug may have been confirmed by someone who doesn't have the ability to set a bug to Triaged or the Confirmed state may not have existed when they were confirmed.  If they still exist and have sufficient information they should move to the Triaged state.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Change the bug's status to "Confirmed" if the reporter replied with enough information '''or'''
* Ask a secondary follow up question and subscribe to the bug report
